creator: ebourg@apache.org
text:
Debian maintains a patch for Ant to support JVMs using GNU Classpath:

http://anonscm.debian.org/viewvc/pkg-java/trunk/ant/debian/patches/0001-detect-classpath-based-JVM.patch?revision=16443&view=co

Could this be integrated in our source code?

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text: if they contribute the patch, sure, why not
The patch is there, ready to be picked up. It's licensed under the Apache License 2.0. What more is needed?
creator: ebourg@apache.org

text:
there must be a reason why they chose to not contribute it upstream - it would make life easier for them, wouldn't it?

I don't contest we'd be legally entitled to grab the patch, personally I wouldn't do it without their explicit consent, though.
creator: bodewig@apache.org

text:
It's quite frequent that patches aren't forwarded upstream, either because the packager didn't care, didn't know the upstream devs would be interested, or simply because he forgot.

I updated the Debian package for Ant 1.9.0 yesterday and noticed this patch, that's why I submit it here now.

There are other patches but they are very Debian specific and are not meant to be integrated upstream (mostly things fixing build issues in a Debian environment).
creator: ebourg@apache.org
